intro: Meliosma microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited meliosma, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often gland-dotted and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in spikes and are followed by small, round, woody fruits. Meliosma microcarpa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
